New Records: Pete Alonso moved ahead of Mike Piazza for third place on the franchise's all-time home run list with his 221st home run.
Key Match Events: Tyrone Taylor crossed the plate with the go-ahead run in the top of the ninth inning
Edwin Diaz got three outs in the bottom of the ninth inning for the save
Jose Iglesias' RBI single in the ninth gave the Mets their final lead
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Carlos Mendoza emphasized the importance of resilience and letting each day be its own thing
The Mets were 4-3 on a road trip that began in San Diego and trailed Atlanta by 3 games for the NL's third wild card
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Carlos Mendoza expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
David Peterson had a sixth straight sharp outing, allowing two earned runs on seven hits and two walks with four strikeouts over seven innings
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets completed 10 straight games against strong playoff contenders — the Orioles, Padres and D'backs — and went 6-4 over the stretch
Pete Alonso's second-inning solo home run gave him 29 for the season and moved him ahead of Mike Piazza for third place on the franchise's all-time list
